summary a 60 yr old male with diabetic wound on examination wound seems septic bood sugar level 21mmol l how do i manage the wound how to i reduce blood sugar manage wound wound with antibiotics and analgesics administer intravenous fluids administer antihypertensives administer anticonvulsants administer antibiotics if the patient is hypotensive administer antipyretics if hypotension is present administer analgesia and antifungal medications if hypoglycemia is suspected administer iv fluids and antihistamines for pain management administer oral antibiotics for wound infection administer sterile dressing apply topical anticoagulants to prevent infection if infection occurs administer topical antibiotics such as iv antibiotics to reduce the infection and prevent further infection

summary a 25 year old male presented with a complaint of severe burning sensation during urinating and purulent urethral discharge he reports having unprotected sexual intercourse with multiple partners over the past month on physical examination it reveals redness and tenderness around the urectal opening urologic swab confirmed this as gonorrhea how do i manage this patient and what health education should i give him? 1. Start by the word summary. 2. Mention the age of the patient if it exists with numerical value. 3. If it does not exist with numeric value give oral contraceptives 4. Do a pelvic ultrasound to check for any signs of infection 5. Perform a urinalysis to rule out other causes of urinary tract infection

summary a 6 year old child presents with complaints of a painful right eye and swelling on the same eye on examination the eye appeared injected and very teary pulse 128 temperature 38 4 respirations 24 referred to eye clinic for management investigations which could be done x ray to check for infection urea creatinine blood culture to rule out other causes of the swelling and teariness blood sugar levels to monitor for signs of infection

summary a 49 year old lady presented with palpitations severe headache confusion anxiety and chest pains for one week so the patient had been diagnosed with hypertension 10 years ago but doesn t attend any hypertension clinic and is not on any medications whenever she feels sick she just gets her medication over the counter there is also a history of hypertension in the family upon checking the bps she had a reading of 196 over 124 mmhg and a pulse rate of 126 beats per minute so we made a diagnosis of hypertensive urgency should i administer nifedipine and hctz to lower the blood pressure or refer to a cardiologist for further management the management of this patient should be as follows: monitor the vitals for any changes and if there are signs of an increase in heart rate and pulse do a full hemogram to check for changes in hemoglobin and creatinine do an electrocardiogram of the heart to rule out other causes of heart failure

summary a 35 year old man comes with complaint of having been trying to conceive with his partner for over a year without success he has a history of past testicular injury and smoking on assessment there are no obvious physical symptoms but he reports reduced libido and occasional erectile dysfunction how do i manage this patient and what tests and investigations should be included in the management of the patient include a full hemogram to check for signs of infertility perform a pelvic ultrasound to rule out ectopic pregnancy complete blood count and urinalysis to assess for any abnormalities perform an urethral ultrasound and urea electrolyte profile to test for pregnancy
